Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of stone materials like Breccia (carbonate-based rock similar to marble) using 1064 nm lasers to remove contaminants without substrate damage; starting at 100 W allows controlled ablation. Max safe ~300 W to avoid cracking due to low thermal conductivity (~2 W/m·K). Source: Manufacturer specs from IPG Photonics fiber lasers for stone cleaning; academic papers on marble ablation (e.g., Pouli et al., Applied Physics A, 2010).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Breccia mineral absorption characteristics
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control
Optimal repetition rate for continuous cleaning coverage
Short pulse duration for efficient ablation of surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for efficient area coverage
Recommended number of cleaning passes for complete surface treatment
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning results
